title: The Museum of Bad Art
content:
[http://www.museumofbadart.org/](http://web.archive.org/web/20060329201526/http:/www.museumofbadart.org/)

Its name says it all, enjoy or at least get a chuckle
author: Dan Weaver

comments.content: I have a bad art collection of my own in my studio, including a faux Van Gogh portrait of a woman who looks like she’s covered in QT lotion (the original self tanner that turned you orange) and has a neck like a bendy straw. We have a fake Picasso, a fake Morandi, a painting of some Teenage Ninja Turtles, and a portrait of Bob Marley in front of a rising sun. But I’m not donating it to anybody.
Dan I saw my first movie at the Dedham Community Theater. Dedham is my family’s home town and were I lived as a kid. A great place.

20 year old kitsch is still kitsch…

peace
If only this had existed before I gave up painting. I could have been famous.
A few years ago when I was in Dedham I went there but it was closed, it seems to only open the museum during Movie times… boohooo…

homage to Dedham MA.

The former home of Rustcraft cards…  
The home of the Federal Court house where the ‘Boston Strangler’ was  
tried, and is down the street from the MOBA.

[http://typophile.com/node/18890#comment](http://web.archive.org/web/20060329201526/http:/typophile.com/node/18890#comment)

The home of the Fairbanks house, the oldest surviving timber frame house in North America.  
 [http://www.fairbankshouse.org/thehouse.asp](http://web.archive.org/web/20060329201526/http:/www.fairbankshouse.org/thehouse.asp)
